page.title: 01Tas Valley at Newton Flotman
page.content: The area comprises gently undulating countryside with mainly cultivated fields but some woodland and grazing land - its central feature is the valley of the winding River Tas. The area is further intersected by the A140 Norwich to Ipswich Rd and the main railway line from Norwich to London. The largest residential area is Newton Flotman with modern dwellings and a population of nearly 1000 people. The nearby village of Saxlingham Nethergate with some 700 inhabitants has many picturesque old cottages, some with reed thatched roofs. Most residents in the area travel to Norwich for work, shopping and leisure pursuits. In the vicinity are two large country houses, Shotesham Park and Rinthrpe Hall, two Elizabethan Old Halls (one )and four medieval
